358.description: Cuando hay viento fuerte, Chimecho chilla colgado de la rama de un árbol o de los aleros de un edificio por la ventosa que tiene en la cabeza. Este Pokémon usa la larga cola que tiene para agarrar bayas y comérselas.
358.name: Chimecho

359.description: Absol tiene la habilidad de predecir las catástrofes naturales. Este Pokémon vive en hábitats montañosos, hostiles y accidentados de los que rara vez se aleja.
359.name: Absol

360.description: Los Wynaut se agrupan cuando hay luna para jugar achuchándose unos a otros. Cuanto más se achuchan, más ganan en resistencia y lanzan fuertes contraataques con más facilidad.
360.name: Wynaut

361.description: Snorunt sobrevive alimentándose solo de nieve y hielo. Se dice que la casa por la que pase este Pokémon estará llena de prosperidad durante generaciones.
361.name: Snorunt

362.description: Glalie tiene la habilidad de controlar el hielo con total libertad. Por ejemplo, puede dejar a su presa totalmente congelada en un instante. Y, una vez helada, la devora lentamente.
362.name: Glalie

363.description: Spheal se desplaza siempre rodando gracias al cuerpo esférico que tiene. Al comenzar la época glacial, es fácil verle rodando por superficies heladas y atravesando el mar.
363.name: Spheal

364.description: Sealeo suele balancear y hacer rodar cosas en la punta del morro. Al mismo tiempo, aprovecha para olerlas y detectar la textura que tienen para ver si le gustan o no.
364.name: Sealeo

365.description: Walrein va nadando por mares glaciales y destrozando icebergs con los enormes e imponentes colmillos que tiene. La gruesa capa de grasa que tiene en el cuerpo hace que los ataques enemigos reboten y no le hagan ningún daño.
365.name: Walrein

366.description: Clamperl crece protegido por la sólida concha que tiene. Si vemos que el cuerpo no le cabe, será porque está a punto de evolucionar.
366.name: Clamperl

367.description: Huntail tiene una cola en forma de pez, que usa para atraer a su presa. Una vez que la tiene cerca, la engulle sin más. Este Pokémon nada haciendo serpentear el cuerpo como si fuera un reptil.
367.name: Huntail

368.description: Aunque Gorebyss es la imagen de la elegancia y la belleza al nadar, es también la definición de la crueldad. Al detectar a su presa, este Pokémon le hinca los finos dientes que tiene y le absorbe los fluidos corporales.
368.name: Gorebyss

369.description: Relicanth pertenece a una rara especie descubierta al explorar el fondo marino. Es grande y está cubierto de toscas y duras escamas, con las que puede soportar la presión del fondo oceánico.
369.name: Relicanth

370.description: Luvdisc tiene forma de corazón y simboliza el amor y el romanticismo. Dicen que la pareja que se encuentre con él mantendrá una relación de amor de por vida.
370.name: Luvdisc

371.description: Bagon sueña siempre con lo mismo: pasar todo un día volando entre las nubes. Frustrado ante la imposibilidad de volar, parece que se desahoga dándose cabezazos contra rocas enormes hasta hacerlas añicos.
371.name: Bagon

372.description: Shelgon está recubierto por una especie de capa ósea: una coraza muy dura que hace rebotar los ataques enemigos. Este Pokémon se esconde en las cavernas para evolucionar.
372.name: Shelgon

373.description: Al evolucionar Shelgon y convertirse por fin en Salamence, ve cumplido el sueño de su vida de tener alas. Para expresar su alegría, Salamence vuela y revolotea por el cielo al tiempo que lanza llamas por la boca.
373.name: Salamence

374.description: Beldum se mantiene flotando en el aire gracias a la fuerza magnética que genera y que repele la gravedad. Para dormir, este Pokémon se ancla a los riscos usando los ganchos que tiene.
374.name: Beldum

375.description: Cuando se funden dos Beldum, uniendo los cerebros por un sistema nervioso magnético, se forma un Metang. Para desplazarse a mayor velocidad, este Pokémon echa los brazos hacia atrás.
375.name: Metang

376.description: Metagross es el resultado de la fusión de dos Metang. Cuando caza, acorrala a su presa, sujetándola contra el suelo con el cuerpo. Después, devora a la víctima indefensa con la gran boca del estómago.
376.name: Metagross

377.description: Regirock está formado en su totalidad por piedras. En un estudio reciente, se descubrió que cada una de las piedras había sido desenterrada en sitios distintos.
377.name: Regirock

378.description: Regice se rodea de un aire gélido que llega a -200 °C y deja congelado a todo lo que se le acerca. Es imposible derretir a este Pokémon; tiene una temperatura demasiado baja.
378.name: Regice

379.description: Hace mucho tiempo Registeel estuvo preso. La gente piensa que el metal del que está hecho es una curiosa sustancia extraterrestre.
379.name: Registeel

380.description: Latias tiene un nivel de inteligencia tan alto que es capaz de entender el lenguaje humano. Este Pokémon usa el plumón cristalizado del que está cubierto como peto para refractar la luz y cambiar de aspecto.
380.name: Latias

381.description: Latios solo le abre el corazón a los Entrenadores compasivos. A la hora de volar, este Pokémon pliega las patas delanteras para minimizar la resistencia al aire y supera en velocidad a un avión a reacción.
381.name: Latios

382.description: A Kyogre siempre se le ha descrito como el Pokémon que expandió los océanos. Varias leyendas cuentan que libró combates contra Groudon en repetidas ocasiones para tener el control de la energía de la naturaleza.
382.name: Kyogre

383.description: Groudon se sirve de la energía de la naturaleza para realizar su Regresión Primigenia y recobrar su apariencia primitiva. Con tal poder, puede crear magma para expandir los continentes.
383.name: Groudon

384.description: Rayquaza ha vivido en la capa de ozono durante millones de años, alimentándose de meteoritos. La energía de estos meteoritos se acumula en su cuerpo y le permite megaevolucionar.
384.name: Rayquaza

385.description: Jirachi despertará de su letargo de miles de años si se le canta con una voz pura. Dicen que este Pokémon hace realidad cualquier deseo que se tenga.
385.name: Jirachi

386.description: Deoxys surgió a partir de un virus espacial. Tiene un alto nivel intelectual y poderes psicoquinéticos. Este Pokémon dispara rayos láser por el órgano cristalino que tiene en el torso.
386.name: Deoxys

387.description: Photosynthesis occurs across its body under the sun. The shell on its back is actually hardened soil.
387.name: Turtwig

388.description: It lives along water in forests. In the daytime, it leaves the forest to sunbathe its treed shell.
388.name: Grotle

389.description: Ancient people imagined that beneath the ground, a gigantic Torterra dwelled.
389.name: Torterra

390.description: Its fiery rear end is fueled by gas made in its belly. Even rain can't extinguish the fire.
390.name: Chimchar

391.description: It skillfully controls the intensity of the fire on its tail to keep its foes at an ideal distance.
391.name: Monferno

392.description: Its crown of fire is indicative of its fiery nature. It is beaten by none in terms of quickness.
392.name: Infernape

393.description: It doesn't like to be taken care of. It's difficult to bond with since it won't listen to its Trainer.
393.name: Piplup

394.description: It lives alone, away from others. Apparently, every one of them believes it is the most important.
394.name: Prinplup

395.description: It swims as fast as a jet boat. The edges of its wings are sharp and can slice apart drifting ice.
395.name: Empoleon

396.description: They flock in great numbers. Though small, they flap their wings with great power.
396.name: Starly

397.description: They maintain huge flocks, although fierce scuffles break out between various flocks.
397.name: Staravia

398.description: The muscles in its wings and legs are strong. It can easily fly while gripping a small Pokémon.
398.name: Staraptor

399.description: With nerves of steel, nothing can perturb it. It is more agile and active than it appears.
399.name: Bidoof

400.description: It busily makes its nest with stacks of branches and roots it has cut up with its sharp incisors.
400.name: Bibarel

401.description: It chats with others using the sounds of its colliding antennae. These sounds are fall hallmarks.
401.name: Kricketot

402.description: It crosses its knifelike arms in front of its chest when it cries. It can compose melodies ad lib.
402.name: Kricketune

403.description: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.
403.name: Shinx

404.description: Its claws loose electricity with enough amperage to cause fainting. They live in small groups.
404.name: Luxio

405.description: When its eyes gleam gold, it can spot hiding prey—even those taking shelter behind a wall.
405.name: Luxray

406.description: When it feels the sun's warm touch, it opens its bud to release pollen. It lives alongside clear pools.
406.name: Budew

407.description: Luring prey with a sweet scent, it uses poison whips on its arms to poison, bind, and finish off the prey.
407.name: Roserade

408.description: It was resurrected from an iron ball-like fossil. It downs prey with its headbutts.
408.name: Cranidos

409.description: Its skull withstands impacts of any magnitude. As a result, its brain never gets the chance to grow.
409.name: Rampardos

410.description: It habitually polishes its face by rubbing it against tree trunks. It is weak to attacks from behind.
410.name: Shieldon

411.description: When they lined up side by side, no foe could break through. They shielded their young in that way.
411.name: Bastiodon

412.description: To shelter itself from cold, wintry winds, it covers itself with a cloak made of twigs and leaves.
412.name: Burmy

413.description: Its appearance changes depending on where it evolved. The materials on hand become a part of its body.
413.name: Wormadam

414.description: It loves the honey of flowers and steals honey collected by Combee.
414.name: Mothim

415.description: The trio is together from birth. It constantly gathers honey from flowers to please Vespiquen.
415.name: Combee

416.description: It houses its colony in cells in its body and releases various pheromones to make those grubs do its bidding.
416.name: Vespiquen

417.description: It makes fur balls that crackle with static electricity. It stores them with berries in tree holes.
417.name: Pachirisu

418.description: It swims by rotating its two tails like a screw. When it dives, its flotation sac collapses.
418.name: Buizel

419.description: It floats using its well-developed flotation sac. It assists in the rescues of drowning people.
419.name: Floatzel

420.description: Sunlight colors it red. When the small ball is drained of nutrients, it shrivels to herald evolution.
420.name: Cherubi

421.description: During times of strong sunlight, its bud blooms, its petals open fully, and it becomes very active.
421.name: Cherrim

422.description: Beware of pushing strongly on its squishy body, as it makes a mysterious purple fluid ooze out.
422.name: Shellos

423.description: When its natural enemy attacks, it oozes purple fluid and escapes.
423.name: Gastrodon

424.description: They work in large colonies and make rings by linking their tails, apparently in friendship.
424.name: Ambipom

425.description: A Pokémon formed by the spirits of people and Pokémon. It loves damp, humid seasons.
425.name: Drifloon

426.description: It carries people and Pokémon when it flies. But since it only drifts, it can end up anywhere.
426.name: Drifblim

427.description: Its ears are always rolled up. They can be forcefully extended to shatter even a large boulder.
427.name: Buneary

428.description: Extremely cautious, it quickly bounds off when it senses danger.
428.name: Lopunny

429.description: It chants incantations. While they usually torment targets, some chants bring happiness.
429.name: Mismagius

430.description: If one utters a deep cry, many Murkrow gather quickly. For this, it is called “Summoner of Night.”
430.name: Honchkrow

431.description: It claws if displeased and purrs when affectionate. Its fickleness is very popular among some.
431.name: Glameow

432.description: It would claim another Pokémon's nest as its own if it finds a nest sufficiently comfortable.
432.name: Purugly

433.description: Each time it hops, it makes a ringing sound. It deafens foes by emitting high-frequency cries.
433.name: Chingling

434.description: It sprays a foul fluid from its rear. Its stench spreads over a mile radius, driving Pokémon away.
434.name: Stunky

435.description: It sprays a vile-smelling fluid from the tip of its tail to attack. Its range is over 160 feet.
435.name: Skuntank

436.description: Ancient people believed that the pattern on Bronzor's back contained a mysterious power.
436.name: Bronzor

437.description: In ages past, this Pokémon was revered as a bringer of rain. It was found buried in the ground.
437.name: Bronzong

438.description: It prefers arid environments. It leaks water from its eyes to adjust its body's fluid levels.
438.name: Bonsly

439.description: In an attempt to confuse its enemy, it mimics the enemy's movements. Then it wastes no time in making itself scarce!
439.name: Mime Jr.

440.description: It carries a round, egg-shaped rock in its belly pouch and gives the rock to its friends.
440.name: Happiny

441.description: It mimics the cries of other Pokémon to trick them into thinking it's one of them. This way they won't attack it.
441.name: Chatot

442.description: A Pokémon that was formed by 108 spirits. It is bound to a fissure in an odd keystone.
442.name: Spiritomb

443.description: It nests in horizontal holes warmed by geothermal heat. Foes who get too close can expect to be pounced on and bitten.
443.name: Gible

444.description: It loves sparkly things. It seeks treasures in caves and hoards the loot in its nest.
444.name: Gabite

445.description: When it folds up its body and extends its wings, it looks like a jet plane. It flies at sonic speed.
445.name: Garchomp

446.description: It hides food under its long body hair. However, it forgets it has hidden the food.
446.name: Munchlax

447.description: It uses the shapes of auras, which change according to emotion, to communicate with others.
447.name: Riolu

448.description: By catching the aura emanating from others, it can read their thoughts and movements.
448.name: Lucario

449.description: It lives in arid places. Instead of perspiration, it expels grainy sand from its body.
449.name: Hippopotas

450.description: It brandishes its gaping mouth in a display of fearsome strength. It raises vast quantities of sand while attacking.
450.name: Hippowdon

451.description: It grips prey with its tail claws and injects poison. It tenaciously hangs on until the poison takes.
451.name: Skorupi

452.description: It takes pride in its strength. Even though it can tear foes apart, it finishes them off with powerful poison.
452.name: Drapion

453.description: Its cheeks hold poison sacs. It tries to catch foes off guard to jab them with toxic fingers.
453.name: Croagunk

454.description: It has a poison sac at its throat. When it croaks, the stored poison is churned for greater potency.
454.name: Toxicroak

455.description: It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling saliva, then chomps down. It takes a whole day to eat prey.
455.name: Carnivine

456.description: The line running down its side can store sunlight. It shines vividly at night.
456.name: Finneon

457.description: It lives on the deep-sea floor. It attracts prey by flashing the patterns on its four tail fins.
457.name: Lumineon

458.description: The pattern on its back varies by region. It often swims in a school of Remoraid.
458.name: Mantyke

459.description: During cold seasons, it migrates to the mountain's lower reaches. It returns to the snow-covered summit in the spring.
459.name: Snover

460.description: It blankets wide areas in snow by whipping up blizzards. It is also known as “The Ice Monster.”
460.name: Abomasnow

461.description: It lives in snowy regions. It carves patterns in trees with its claws as a signal to others.
461.name: Weavile

462.description: Sometimes the magnetism emitted by Magnezone is too strong, making them attract each other so they cannot move.
462.name: Magnezone

463.description: It wraps things with its extensible tongue. Getting too close to it will leave you soaked with drool.
463.name: Lickilicky

464.description: From holes in its palms, it fires out Geodude. Its carapace can withstand volcanic eruptions.
464.name: Rhyperior

465.description: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.
465.name: Tangrowth

466.description: As its electric charge amplifies, blue sparks begin to crackle between its horns.
466.name: Electivire

467.description: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit from the ends of its arms. It lives in volcanic craters.
467.name: Magmortar

468.description: As everyone knows, it visits peaceful regions, bringing them gifts of kindness and sweet blessings.
468.name: Togekiss

469.description: It prefers to battle by biting apart foes' heads instantly while flying by at high speed.
469.name: Yanmega

470.description: When you see Leafeon asleep in a patch of sunshine, you'll know it is using photosynthesis to produce clean air.
470.name: Leafeon

471.description: By controlling its body heat, it can freeze the atmosphere around it to make a diamond-dust flurry.
471.name: Glaceon

472.description: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!
472.name: Gliscor

473.description: A frozen Mamoswine was dug from ice dating back 10,000 years. This Pokémon has been around a long, long, long time.
473.name: Mamoswine

474.description: Additional software was installed to make it a better Pokémon. It began acting oddly, however.
474.name: Porygon-Z

475.description: Because it can sense what its foe is thinking, its attacks burst out first, fast, and fierce.
475.name: Gallade

476.description: It exudes strong magnetism from all over. It controls three small units called Mini-Noses.
476.name: Probopass

477.description: It is said to take lost spirits into its pliant body and guide them home.
477.name: Dusknoir

478.description: It freezes foes with an icy breath nearly -60 degrees Fahrenheit. What seems to be its body is actually hollow.
478.name: Froslass

479.description: Research continues on this Pokémon, which could be the power source of a unique motor.
479.name: Rotom

480.description: Known as “The Being of Knowledge.” It is said that it can wipe out the memory of those who see its eyes.
480.name: Uxie

481.description: Known as “The Being of Emotion.” It taught humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.
481.name: Mesprit

482.description: Known as “The Being of Willpower.” It sleeps at the bottom of a lake to keep the world in balance.
482.name: Azelf

483.description: A Pokémon spoken of in legend. It is said that time began moving when Dialga was born.
483.name: Dialga

484.description: It is said to live in a gap in the spatial dimension parallel to ours. It appears in mythology.
484.name: Palkia

485.description: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.
485.name: Heatran

486.description: It is said to have made Pokémon that look like itself from a special ice mountain, rocks, and magma.
486.name: Regigigas

487.description: This Pokémon is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours, where common knowledge is distorted and strange.
487.name: Giratina

488.description: Shiny particles are released from its wings like a veil. It is said to represent the crescent moon.
488.name: Cresselia

489.description: When the water warms, they inflate the flotation sac on their heads and drift languidly on the sea in packs.
489.name: Phione

490.description: It is born with a wondrous power that lets it bond with any kind of Pokémon.
490.name: Manaphy

491.description: It chases people and Pokémon from its territory by causing them to experience deep, nightmarish slumbers.
491.name: Darkrai

492.description: It can dissolve toxins in the air to instantly transform ruined land into a lush field of flowers.
492.name: Shaymin

493.description: According to the legends of Sinnoh, this Pokémon emerged from an egg and shaped all there is in this world.
493.name: Arceus

494.description: This Pokémon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.
494.name: Victini

495.description: Being exposed to sunlight makes its movements swifter. It uses vines more adeptly than its hands.
495.name: Snivy

496.description: It moves along the ground as if sliding. Its swift movements befuddle its foes, and it then attacks with a vine whip.
496.name: Servine

497.description: It only gives its all against strong opponents who are not fazed by the glare from Serperior's noble eyes.
497.name: Serperior

498.description: It can deftly dodge its foe's attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.
498.name: Tepig

499.description: The more it eats, the more fuel it has to make the fire in its stomach stronger. This fills it with even more power.
499.name: Pignite

500.description: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.
500.name: Emboar

501.description: The scalchop on its stomach isn't just used for battle—it can be used to break open hard berries as well.
501.name: Oshawott

502.description: Strict training is how it learns its flowing double-scalchop technique.
502.name: Dewott

503.description: In the time it takes a foe to blink, it can draw and sheathe the seamitars attached to its front legs.
503.name: Samurott

504.description: Using food stored in cheek pouches, they can keep watch for days. They use their tails to communicate with others.
504.name: Patrat

505.description: Using luminescent matter, it makes its eyes and body glow and stuns attacking opponents.
505.name: Watchog

506.description: The long hair around its face provides an amazing radar that lets it sense subtle changes in its surroundings.
506.name: Lillipup

507.description: This very loyal Pokémon helps Trainers, and it also takes care of other Pokémon.
507.name: Herdier

508.description: It rescues people stranded by blizzards in the mountains. Its shaggy fur shields it from the cold.
508.name: Stoutland

509.description: Its cute act is a ruse. When victims let down their guard, they find their items taken. It attacks with sharp claws.
509.name: Purrloin

510.description: Their beautiful form comes from the muscles they have developed. They run silently in the night.
510.name: Liepard

511.description: It shares the leaf on its head with weary-looking Pokémon. These leaves are known to relieve stress.
511.name: Pansage

512.description: It attacks enemies with strikes of its thorn-covered tail. This Pokémon is wild tempered.
512.name: Simisage

513.description: Very intelligent, it roasts berries before eating them. It likes to help people.
513.name: Pansear

514.description: A flame burns inside its body. It scatters embers from its head and tail to sear its opponents.
514.name: Simisear

515.description: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. It waters plants with it using its tail.
515.name: Panpour

516.description: The high-pressure water expelled from its tail is so powerful, it can destroy a concrete wall.
516.name: Simipour

517.description: This Pokémon appears before people and Pokémon who are having nightmares and eats those dreams.
517.name: Munna

518.description: The mist emanating from their foreheads is packed with the dreams of people and Pokémon.
518.name: Musharna

519.description: This very forgetful Pokémon will wait for a new order from its Trainer even though it already has one.
519.name: Pidove

520.description: Many people believe that, deep in the forest where Tranquill live, there is a peaceful place where there is no war.
520.name: Tranquill

521.description: Males swing their head plumage to threaten opponents. The females' flying abilities surpass those of the males.
521.name: Unfezant

522.description: When thunderclouds cover the sky, it will appear. It can catch lightning with its mane and store the electricity.
522.name: Blitzle

523.description: When this ill-tempered Pokémon runs wild, it shoots lightning from its mane in all directions.
523.name: Zebstrika

524.description: Its ear is hexagonal in shape. Compressed underground, its body is as hard as steel.
524.name: Roggenrola

525.description: Because its energy was too great to be contained, the energy leaked and formed orange crystals.
525.name: Boldore

526.description: The solar rays it absorbs are processed in its energy core and fired as a ball of light.
526.name: Gigalith

527.description: Its habitat is dark forests and caves. It emits ultrasonic waves from its nose to learn about its surroundings.
527.name: Woobat

528.description: It shakes its tail vigorously when it emits ultrasonic waves strong enough to reduce concrete to rubble.
528.name: Swoobat

529.description: It makes its way swiftly through the soil by putting both claws together and rotating at high speed.
529.name: Drilbur

530.description: It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has evolved into steel strong enough to bore through iron plates.
530.name: Excadrill

531.description: Using the feelers on its ears, it can tell how someone is feeling or when an egg might hatch.
531.name: Audino

532.description: These Pokémon appear at building sites and help out with construction. They always carry squared logs.
532.name: Timburr

533.description: With strengthened bodies, they skillfully wield steel beams to take down buildings.
533.name: Gurdurr

534.description: It is thought that Conkeldurr taught humans how to make concrete more than 2,000 years ago.
534.name: Conkeldurr

535.description: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans and warns others of danger.
535.name: Tympole

536.description: When they vibrate the bumps on their heads, they can make waves in water or earthquake-like vibrations on land.
536.name: Palpitoad

537.description: It increases the power of its punches by vibrating the bumps on its fists. It can turn a boulder to rubble with one punch.
537.name: Seismitoad

538.description: When it tightens its belt, it becomes stronger. Wild Throh use vines to weave their own belts.
538.name: Throh

539.description: Desiring the strongest karate chop, they seclude themselves in mountains and train without sleeping.
539.name: Sawk

540.description: This Pokémon makes clothes for itself. It chews up leaves and sews them with sticky thread extruded from its mouth.
540.name: Sewaddle

541.description: Forests where Swadloon live have superb foliage because the nutrients they make from fallen leaves nourish the plant life.
541.name: Swadloon

542.description: Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves clothing for it from leaves by using the sticky silk secreted from its mouth.
542.name: Leavanny

543.description: It discovers what is going on around it by using the feelers on its head and tail. It is brutally aggressive.
543.name: Venipede

544.description: Protected by a hard shell, it spins its body like a wheel and crashes furiously into its enemies.
544.name: Whirlipede

545.description: It clasps its prey with the claws on its neck until it stops moving. Then it finishes it off with deadly poison.
545.name: Scolipede

546.description: When attacked, it escapes by shooting cotton from its body. The cotton serves as a decoy to distract the attacker.
546.name: Cottonee

547.description: They appear along with whirlwinds. They pull pranks, such as moving furniture and leaving balls of cotton in homes.
547.name: Whimsicott

548.description: The leaves on its head are very bitter. Eating one of these leaves is known to refresh a tired body.
548.name: Petilil

549.description: The fragrance of the garland on its head has a relaxing effect. It withers if a Trainer does not take good care of it.
549.name: Lilligant

550.description: Red- and blue-striped Basculin are very violent and always fighting. They are also remarkably tasty.
550.name: Basculin

551.description: It moves along below the sand's surface, except for its nose and eyes. A dark membrane shields its eyes from the sun.
551.name: Sandile

552.description: They live in groups of a few individuals. Protective membranes shield their eyes from sandstorms.
552.name: Krokorok

553.description: Very violent Pokémon, they try to clamp down on anything that moves in front of their eyes.
553.name: Krookodile

554.description: Darumaka's droppings are hot, so people used to put them in their clothes to keep themselves warm.
554.name: Darumaka

555.description: When one is injured in a fierce battle, it hardens into a stone-like form. Then it meditates and sharpens its mind.
555.name: Darmanitan

556.description: It uses an up-tempo song and dance to drive away the bird Pokémon that prey on its flower seeds.
556.name: Maractus

557.description: It makes a hole in a suitable rock. If that rock breaks, the Pokémon remains agitated until it locates a replacement.
557.name: Dwebble

558.description: It possesses legs of enormous strength, enabling it to carry heavy slabs for many days, even when crossing arid land.
558.name: Crustle

559.description: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling its skin up to its neck.
559.name: Scraggy

560.description: It pulls up its shed skin to protect itself while it kicks. The bigger the crest, the more respected it is.
560.name: Scrafty

561.description: The guardians of an ancient city, they use their psychic power to attack enemies that invade their territory.
561.name: Sigilyph

562.description: These Pokémon arose from the spirits of people interred in graves. Each retains memories of its former life.
562.name: Yamask

563.description: It has been said that they swallow those who get too close and turn them into mummies. They like to eat gold nuggets.
563.name: Cofagrigus

564.description: About 100 million years ago, these Pokémon swam in oceans. It is thought they also went on land to attack prey.
564.name: Tirtouga

565.description: They can live both in the ocean and on land. A slap from one of them is enough to open a hole in the bottom of a tanker.
565.name: Carracosta

566.description: Revived from a fossil, this Pokémon is thought to be the ancestor of all bird Pokémon.
566.name: Archen

567.description: They are intelligent and will cooperate to catch prey. From the ground, they use a running start to take flight.
567.name: Archeops

568.description: The combination of garbage bags and industrial waste caused the chemical reaction that created this Pokémon.
568.name: Trubbish

569.description: It clenches opponents with its left arm and finishes them off with foul-smelling poison gas belched from its mouth.
569.name: Garbodor

570.description: It changes so it looks just like its foe, tricks it, and then uses that opportunity to flee.
570.name: Zorua

571.description: Each has the ability to fool a large group of people simultaneously. They protect their lair with illusory scenery.
571.name: Zoroark

572.description: Minccino greet each other by grooming one another thoroughly with their tails.
572.name: Minccino

573.description: Their white fur feels amazing to touch. Their fur repels dust and prevents static electricity from building up.
573.name: Cinccino

574.description: Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic power. They are always staring at something.
574.name: Gothita

575.description: Starlight is the source of their power. At night, they mark star positions by using psychic power to float stones.
575.name: Gothorita

576.description: Starry skies thousands of light-years away are visible in the space distorted by their intense psychic power.
576.name: Gothitelle

577.description: Because their bodies are enveloped in a special liquid, they are fine in any environment, no matter how severe.
577.name: Solosis

578.description: Since they have two divided brains, at times they suddenly try to take two different actions at once.
578.name: Duosion

579.description: They use psychic power to control their arms, which are made of a special liquid. They can crush boulders psychically.
579.name: Reuniclus

580.description: When attacked, it uses its feathers to splash water, escaping under cover of the spray.
580.name: Ducklett

581.description: Despite their elegant appearance, they can flap their wings strongly and fly for thousands of miles.
581.name: Swanna

582.description: The temperature of their breath is -58 degrees Fahrenheit. They create snow crystals and make snow fall in the areas around them.
582.name: Vanillite

583.description: They cool down the surrounding air and create ice particles, which they use to freeze their foes.
583.name: Vanillish

584.description: If both heads get angry simultaneously, this Pokémon expels a blizzard, burying everything in snow.
584.name: Vanilluxe

585.description: Their coloring changes according to the seasons and can be slightly affected by the temperature and humidity as well.
585.name: Deerling

586.description: They migrate according to the seasons. People can tell the season by looking at Sawsbuck's horns.
586.name: Sawsbuck

587.description: They live on treetops and glide using the inside of a cape-like membrane while discharging electricity.
587.name: Emolga

588.description: These mysterious Pokémon evolve when they receive electrical stimulation while they are in the same place as Shelmet.
588.name: Karrablast

589.description: Wearing the shell covering they stole from Shelmet, they defend themselves and attack with two lances.
589.name: Escavalier

590.description: It lures people in with its Poké Ball pattern, then releases poison spores. Why it resembles a Poké Ball is unknown.
590.name: Foongus

591.description: They show off their Poké Ball caps to lure prey, but very few Pokémon are fooled by this.
591.name: Amoonguss

592.description: They paralyze prey with poison, then drag them down to their lairs, five miles below the surface.
592.name: Frillish

593.description: Its body is mostly seawater. It's said there's a castle of ships Jellicent have sunk on the seafloor.
593.name: Jellicent

594.description: Floating in the open sea is how they live. When they find a wounded Pokémon, they embrace it and bring it to shore.
594.name: Alomomola

595.description: Since it can't generate its own electricity, it sticks onto large-bodied Pokémon and absorbs static electricity.
595.name: Joltik

596.description: They employ an electrically charged web to trap their prey. While it is immobilized by shock, they leisurely consume it.
596.name: Galvantula

597.description: When threatened, it attacks by shooting a barrage of spikes, which gives it a chance to escape by rolling away.
597.name: Ferroseed

598.description: By swinging around its three spiky feelers and shooting spikes, it can obliterate an opponent.
598.name: Ferrothorn

599.description: Interlocking two bodies and spinning around generates the energy they need to live.
599.name: Klink

600.description: By changing the direction in which it rotates, it communicates its feelings to others. When angry, it rotates faster.
600.name: Klang

601.description: The gear with the red core is rotated at high speed for a rapid energy charge.
601.name: Klinklang

602.description: While one alone doesn't have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.
602.name: Tynamo

603.description: It wraps itself around its prey and paralyzes it with electricity from the round spots on its sides. Then it chomps.
603.name: Eelektrik

604.description: With their sucker mouths, they suck in prey. Then they use their fangs to shock the prey with electricity.
604.name: Eelektross

605.description: It uses its strong psychic power to squeeze its opponent's brain, causing unendurable headaches.
605.name: Elgyem

606.description: Apparently, it communicates by flashing its three fingers, but those patterns haven't been decoded.
606.name: Beheeyem

607.description: While shining a light and pretending to be a guide, it leeches off the life force of any who follow it.
607.name: Litwick

608.description: The spirits it absorbs fuel its baleful fire. It hangs around hospitals waiting for people to pass on.
608.name: Lampent

609.description: Being consumed in Chandelure's flame burns up the spirit, leaving the body behind.
609.name: Chandelure

610.description: They use their tusks to crush the berries they eat. Repeated regrowth makes their tusks strong and sharp.
610.name: Axew

611.description: Their tusks can shatter rocks. Territory battles between Fraxure can be intensely violent.
611.name: Fraxure

612.description: They are kind but can be relentless when defending territory. They challenge foes with tusks that can cut steel.
612.name: Haxorus

613.description: Its nose is always running. It sniffs the snot back up because the mucus provides the raw material for its moves.
613.name: Cubchoo

614.description: They love the cold seas of the north. They create pathways across the ocean waters by freezing their own breath.
614.name: Beartic

615.description: They are born in snow clouds. They use chains made of ice crystals to capture prey.
615.name: Cryogonal

616.description: When it and Karrablast are together, and both receive electrical stimulation, they both evolve.
616.name: Shelmet

617.description: Having removed its heavy shell, it becomes very light and can fight with ninja-like movements.
617.name: Accelgor

618.description: Its skin is very hard, so it is unhurt even if stepped on by sumo wrestlers. It smiles when transmitting electricity.
618.name: Stunfisk

619.description: It takes pride in the speed at which it can use moves. What it loses in power, it makes up for in quantity.
619.name: Mienfoo

620.description: It wields the fur on its arms like a whip. Its arm attacks come with such rapidity that they cannot even be seen.
620.name: Mienshao

621.description: It races through narrow caves, using its sharp claws to catch prey. The skin on its face is harder than a rock.
621.name: Druddigon

622.description: The energy that burns inside it enables it to move, but no one has yet been able to identify this energy.
622.name: Golett

623.description: It is said that Golurk were ordered to protect people and Pokémon by the ancient people who made them.
623.name: Golurk

624.description: Blades comprise this Pokémon's entire body. If battling dulls the blades, it sharpens them on stones by the river.
624.name: Pawniard

625.description: This pitiless Pokémon commands a group of Pawniard to hound prey into immobility. It then moves in to finish the prey off.
625.name: Bisharp

626.description: They charge wildly and headbutt everything. Their headbutts have enough destructive force to derail a train.
626.name: Bouffalant

627.description: They crush berries with their talons. They bravely stand up to any opponent, no matter how strong it is.
627.name: Rufflet

628.description: For the sake of its friends, this brave warrior of the sky will not stop battling, even if injured.
628.name: Braviary

629.description: Its wings are too tiny to allow it to fly. As the time approaches for it to evolve, it discards the bones it was wearing.
629.name: Vullaby

630.description: They fly in circles around the sky. When they spot prey, they attack and carry it back to their nest with ease.
630.name: Mandibuzz

631.description: Using their very hot, flame-covered tongues, they burn through Durant's steel bodies and consume their insides.
631.name: Heatmor

632.description: Individuals each play different roles in driving Heatmor, their natural predator, away from their colony.
632.name: Durant

633.description: They cannot see, so they tackle and bite to learn about their surroundings. Their bodies are covered in wounds.
633.name: Deino

634.description: The two heads do not get along. Whichever head eats more than the other gets to be the leader.
634.name: Zweilous

635.description: The heads on their arms do not have brains. They use all three heads to consume and destroy everything.
635.name: Hydreigon

636.description: Said to have been born from the sun, it spews fire from its horns and encases itself in a cocoon of fire when it evolves.
636.name: Larvesta

637.description: A sea of fire engulfs the surroundings of their battles, since they use their six wings to scatter their ember scales.
637.name: Volcarona

638.description: It has a body and heart of steel. Its glare is sufficient to make even an unruly Pokémon obey it.
638.name: Cobalion

639.description: Its charge is strong enough to break through a giant castle wall in one blow. This Pokémon is spoken of in legends.
639.name: Terrakion

640.description: Its head sprouts horns as sharp as blades. Using whirlwind-like movements, it confounds and swiftly cuts opponents.
640.name: Virizion

641.description: The lower half of its body is wrapped in a cloud of energy. It zooms through the sky at 200 mph.
641.name: Tornadus

642.description: The spikes on its tail discharge immense bolts of lightning. It flies around the Unova region firing off lightning bolts.
642.name: Thundurus

643.description: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with fire. It helps those who want to build a world of truth.
643.name: Reshiram

644.description: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with lightning. It assists those who want to build an ideal world.
644.name: Zekrom

645.description: Lands visited by Landorus grant such bountiful crops that it has been hailed as “The Guardian of the Fields.”
645.name: Landorus

646.description: This legendary ice Pokémon waits for a hero to fill in the missing parts of its body with truth or ideals.
646.name: Kyurem

647.description: It crosses the world, running over the surfaces of oceans and rivers. It appears at scenic waterfronts.
647.name: Keldeo

648.description: The melodies sung by Meloetta have the power to make Pokémon that hear them happy or sad.
648.name: Meloetta

649.description: This ancient bug Pokémon was altered by Team Plasma. They upgraded the cannon on its back.
649.name: Genesect

650.description: The quills on its head are usually soft. When it flexes them, the points become so hard and sharp that they can pierce rock.
650.name: Chespin

651.description: It relies on its sturdy shell to deflect predators' attacks. It counterattacks with its sharp quills.
651.name: Quilladin

652.description: Its Tackle is forceful enough to flip a 50-ton tank. It shields its allies from danger with its own body.
652.name: Chesnaught

653.description: Eating a twig fills it with energy, and its roomy ears give vent to air hotter than 390 degrees Fahrenheit.
653.name: Fennekin

654.description: It has a twig stuck in its tail. With friction from its tail fur, it sets the twig on fire and launches into battle.
654.name: Braixen

655.description: It gazes into the flame at the tip of its branch to achieve a focused state, which allows it to see into the future.
655.name: Delphox

656.description: It secretes flexible bubbles from its chest and back. The bubbles reduce the damage it would otherwise take when attacked.
656.name: Froakie

657.description: It can throw bubble-covered pebbles with precise control, hitting empty cans up to a hundred feet away.
657.name: Frogadier

658.description: It creates throwing stars out of compressed water. When it spins them and throws them at high speed, these stars can split metal in two.
658.name: Greninja

659.description: They use their large ears to dig burrows. They will dig the whole night through.
659.name: Bunnelby

660.description: With their powerful ears, they can heft boulders of a ton or more with ease. They can be a big help at construction sites.
660.name: Diggersby

661.description: These friendly Pokémon send signals to one another with beautiful chirps and tail-feather movements.
661.name: Fletchling

662.description: From its beak, it expels embers that set the tall grass on fire. Then it pounces on the bewildered prey that pop out of the grass.
662.name: Fletchinder

663.description: In the fever of an exciting battle, it showers embers from the gaps between its feathers and takes to the air.
663.name: Talonflame

664.description: When under attack from bird Pokémon, it spews a poisonous black powder that causes paralysis on contact.
664.name: Scatterbug

665.description: It lives hidden within thicket shadows. When predators attack, it quickly bristles the fur covering its body in an effort to threaten them.
665.name: Spewpa

666.description: Vivillon with many different patterns are found all over the world. These patterns are affected by the climate of their habitat.
666.name: Vivillon

667.description: The stronger the opponent it faces, the more heat surges from its mane and the more power flows through its body.
667.name: Litleo

668.description: The male with the largest mane of fire is the leader of the pride.
668.name: Pyroar

669.description: It draws out and controls the hidden power of flowers. The flower Flabébé holds is most likely part of its body.
669.name: Flabébé

670.description: It flutters around fields of flowers and cares for flowers that are starting to wilt. It draws out the hidden power of flowers to battle.
670.name: Floette

671.description: It claims exquisite flower gardens as its territory, and it obtains power from basking in the energy emitted by flowering plants.
671.name: Florges

672.description: Thought to be one of the first Pokémon to live in harmony with humans, it has a placid disposition.
672.name: Skiddo

673.description: It can tell how its Trainer is feeling by subtle shifts in the grip on its horns. This empathic sense lets them run as if one being.
673.name: Gogoat

674.description: It does its best to be taken seriously by its enemies, but its glare is not sufficiently intimidating. Chewing on a leaf is its trademark.
674.name: Pancham

675.description: Although it possesses a violent temperament, it won't put up with bullying. It uses the leaf in its mouth to sense the movements of its enemies.
675.name: Pangoro

676.description: Trimming its fluffy fur not only makes it more elegant but also increases the swiftness of its movements.
676.name: Furfrou

677.description: The organ that emits its intense psychic power is sheltered by its ears to keep power from leaking out.
677.name: Espurr

678.description: When in danger, it raises its ears and releases enough psychic power to grind a 10-ton truck into dust.
678.name: Meowstic

679.description: Apparently this Pokémon is born when a departed spirit inhabits a sword. It attaches itself to people and drinks their life force.
679.name: Honedge

680.description: When Honedge evolves, it divides into two swords, which cooperate via telepathy to coordinate attacks and slash their enemies to ribbons.
680.name: Doublade

681.description: Generations of kings were attended by these Pokémon, which used their spectral power to manipulate and control people and Pokémon.
681.name: Aegislash

682.description: It emits a scent that enraptures those who smell it. This fragrance changes depending on what it has eaten.
682.name: Spritzee

683.description: It devises various scents, pleasant and unpleasant, and emits scents that its enemies dislike in order to gain an edge in battle.
683.name: Aromatisse

684.description: To entangle its opponents in battle, it extrudes white threads as sweet and sticky as cotton candy.
684.name: Swirlix

685.description: It can distinguish the faintest of scents. It puts its sensitive sense of smell to use by helping pastry chefs in their work.
685.name: Slurpuff

686.description: Opponents who stare at the flashing of the light-emitting spots on its body become dazed and lose their will to fight.
686.name: Inkay

687.description: It wields the most compelling hypnotic powers of any Pokémon, and it forces others to do whatever it wants.
687.name: Malamar

688.description: Two Binacle live together on one rock. When they fight, one of them will move to a different rock.
688.name: Binacle

689.description: When they evolve, two Binacle multiply into seven. They fight with the power of seven Binacle.
689.name: Barbaracle

690.description: Camouflaged as rotten kelp, they spray liquid poison on prey that approaches unawares and then finish it off.
690.name: Skrelp

691.description: Their poison is strong enough to eat through the hull of a tanker, and they spit it indiscriminately at anything that enters their territory.
691.name: Dragalge

692.description: They knock down flying prey by firing compressed water from their massive claws like shooting a pistol.
692.name: Clauncher

693.description: Their enormous claws launch cannonballs of water powerful enough to pierce tanker hulls.
693.name: Clawitzer

694.description: They make their home in deserts. They can generate their energy from basking in the sun, so eating food is not a requirement.
694.name: Helioptile

695.description: They flare their frills and generate energy. A single Heliolisk can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper.
695.name: Heliolisk

696.description: This Pokémon was restored from a fossil. If something happens that it doesn't like, it throws a tantrum and runs wild.
696.name: Tyrunt

697.description: Thanks to its gargantuan jaws, which could shred thick metal plates as if they were paper, it was invincible in the ancient world it once inhabited.
697.name: Tyrantrum

698.description: This ancient Pokémon was restored from part of its body that had been frozen in ice for over 100 million years.
698.name: Amaura

699.description: The diamond-shaped crystals on its body expel air as cold as -240 degrees Fahrenheit, surrounding its enemies and encasing them in ice.
699.name: Aurorus

700.description: It sends a soothing aura from its ribbonlike feelers to calm fights.
700.name: Sylveon

701.description: Although its body is small, its proficient fighting skills enable it to keep up with big bruisers like Machamp and Hariyama.
701.name: Hawlucha

702.description: Its whiskers serve as antennas. By sending and receiving electrical waves, it can communicate with others over vast distances.
702.name: Dedenne

703.description: Born from the temperatures and pressures deep underground, it fires beams from the stone in its head.
703.name: Carbink

704.description: The weakest Dragon-type Pokémon, it lives in damp, shady places, so its body doesn't dry out.
704.name: Goomy

705.description: It drives away opponents by excreting a sticky liquid that can dissolve anything. Its eyes devolved, so it can't see anything.
705.name: Sliggoo

706.description: This very friendly Dragon-type Pokémon will hug its beloved Trainer, leaving that Trainer covered in sticky slime.
706.name: Goodra

707.description: These key collectors threaten any attackers by fiercely jingling their keys at them.
707.name: Klefki

708.description: These Pokémon are created when spirits possess rotten tree stumps. They prefer to live in abandoned forests.
708.name: Phantump

709.description: It can control trees at will. It will trap people who harm the forest, so they can never leave.
709.name: Trevenant

710.description: The pumpkin body is inhabited by a spirit trapped in this world. As the sun sets, it becomes restless and active.
710.name: Pumpkaboo

711.description: Singing in eerie voices, they wander town streets on the night of the new moon. Anyone who hears their song is cursed.
711.name: Gourgeist

712.description: It blocks opponents' attacks with the ice that shields its body. It uses cold air to repair any cracks with new ice.
712.name: Bergmite

713.description: Its ice-covered body is as hard as steel. Its cumbersome frame crushes anything that stands in its way.
713.name: Avalugg

714.description: They live in pitch-black caves. Their enormous ears can emit ultrasonic waves of 200,000 hertz.
714.name: Noibat

715.description: They fly around on moonless nights and attack careless prey. Nothing can beat them in a battle in the dark.
715.name: Noivern

716.description: Legends say it can share eternal life. It slept for a thousand years in the form of a tree before its revival.
716.name: Xerneas

717.description: When this legendary Pokémon's wings and tail feathers spread wide and glow red, it absorbs the life force of living creatures.
717.name: Yveltal

718.description: This is Zygarde's form when it has gathered 50% of its cells. It wipes out all those who oppose it, showing not a shred of mercy.
718.name: Zygarde

719.description: A sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.
719.name: Diancie

720.description: In its true form, it possesses a huge amount of power. Legends of its avarice tell how it once carried off an entire castle to gain the treasure hidden within.
720.name: Hoopa

721.description: It lets out billows of steam and disappears into the dense fog. It's said to live in mountains where humans do not tread.
721.name: Volcanion

722.description: This wary Pokémon uses photosynthesis to store up energy during the day, while becoming active at night.
722.name: Rowlet

723.description: A bit of a dandy, it spends its free time preening its wings. Its preoccupation with any dirt on its plumage can leave it unable to battle.
723.name: Dartrix

724.description: It fires arrow quills from its wings with such precision, they can pierce a pebble at distances over a hundred yards.
724.name: Decidueye

725.description: While grooming itself, it builds up fur inside its stomach. It sets the fur alight and spews fiery attacks, which change based on how it coughs.
725.name: Litten

726.description: At its throat, it bears a bell of fire. The bell rings brightly whenever this Pokémon spits fire.
726.name: Torracat

727.description: This Pokémon has a violent, selfish disposition. If it's not in the mood to listen, it will ignore its Trainer's orders with complete nonchalance.
727.name: Incineroar

728.description: This Pokémon snorts body fluids from its nose, blowing balloons to smash into its foes. It's famous for being a hard worker.
728.name: Popplio

729.description: A skillful dancer, it creates a sequence of water balloons as it dances, and briskly bombards its enemies.
729.name: Brionne

730.description: It controls its water balloons with song. The melody is learned from others of its kind and is passed down from one generation to the next.
730.name: Primarina

731.description: It can peck at a rate of 16 times a second to drill holes in trees. It uses the holes for food storage and for nesting.
731.name: Pikipek

732.description: It eats berries and stores their seeds in its beak. When it encounters enemies or prey, it fires off all the seeds in a burst.
732.name: Trumbeak

733.description: When it battles, its beak heats up. The temperature can easily exceed 212 degrees Fahrenheit, causing severe burns when it hits.
733.name: Toucannon

734.description: With its sharp fangs, it will bite anything. It did not originally live in Alola but was imported from another region.
734.name: Yungoos

735.description: When it finds a trace of its prey, it patiently stakes out the location...but it's always snoozing by nightfall.
735.name: Gumshoos

736.description: Its strong jaw enables it to scrape trees and slurp out the sap. It normally lives underground.
736.name: Grubbin

737.description: Its body is capable of storing electricity. On camping trips, people are grateful to have one around.
737.name: Charjabug

738.description: It zips around, on sharp lookout for an opening. It concentrates electrical energy within its large jaws and uses it to zap its enemies.
738.name: Vikavolt

739.description: While guarding its weak points with its pincers, it looks for an opening and unleashes punches. When it loses, it foams at the mouth and faints.
739.name: Crabrawler

740.description: It aimed for the top but got lost and ended up on a snowy mountain. Being forced to endure the cold, this Pokémon evolved and grew fur.
740.name: Crabominable

741.description: Baile Style: It beats its wings together to create fire. As it moves in the steps of its beautiful dance, it bathes opponents in intense flames. Pom-Pom Style: This Oricorio has sipped bright yellow nectar. Its bright, cheerful dance melts the hearts of its enemies. Pa'u Style: This Oricorio relaxes by swaying gently. This increases its psychic energy, which it then fires at its enemies. Sensu Style: This Oricorio has sipped purple nectar. Its elegant, attractive dance will send the minds and hearts of its enemies to another world.
741.name: Oricorio

742.description: It feeds on the nectar and pollen of flowers. Because it's able to sense auras, it can identify which flowers are about to bloom.
742.name: Cutiefly

743.description: It rolls up pollen into puffs. It makes many different varieties, some used as food and others used in battle.
743.name: Ribombee

744.description: It's considered to be a good Pokémon for beginners because of its friendliness, but its disposition grows rougher as it grows up.
744.name: Rockruff

745.description: Midday Form: Its quick movements confuse its enemies. Well equipped with claws and fangs, it also uses the sharp rocks in its mane as weapons. Midnight Form: The more intimidating the opponent it faces, the more this Pokémon's blood boils. It will attack with no regard for its own safety.
745.name: Lycanroc

746.description: Solo Form: When it's in trouble, its eyes moisten and begin to shine. The shining light attracts its comrades, and they stand together against their enemies. School Form: Weak Wishiwashi school together to concentrate their power. Their united force makes them the demon of the sea, feared near and far.
746.name: Wishiwashi

747.description: It plunges the poison spike on its head into its prey. When the prey has weakened, Mareanie deals the finishing blow with its 10 tentacles.
747.name: Mareanie

748.description: Toxapex crawls along the ocean floor on its 12 legs. It leaves a trail of Corsola bits scattered in its wake.
748.name: Toxapex

749.description: The mud stuck to Mudbray's hooves enhances its grip and its powerful running gait.
749.name: Mudbray

750.description: It spits a mud that provides resistance to both wind and rain, so the walls of old houses were often coated with it.
750.name: Mudsdale

751.description: It crawls onto the land in search of food. Its water bubble allows it to breathe and protects its soft head.
751.name: Dewpider

752.description: It delivers headbutts with the water bubble on its head. Small Pokémon get sucked into the bubble, where they drown.
752.name: Araquanid

753.description: During the day, it sleeps and soaks up light. When night falls, it walks around looking for a safer place to sleep.
753.name: Fomantis

754.description: It requires a lot of effort to maintain Lurantis's vivid coloring, but some collectors enjoy this work and treat it as their hobby.
754.name: Lurantis

755.description: It scatters spores that flicker and glow. Anyone seeing these lights falls into a deep slumber.
755.name: Morelull

756.description: Forests where Shiinotic live are treacherous to enter at night. People confused by its strange lights can never find their way home again.
756.name: Shiinotic

757.description: It burns its bodily fluids to create a poisonous gas. When its enemies become disoriented from inhaling the gas, it attacks them.
757.name: Salandit

758.description: For some reason, only females have been found. It creates a reverse harem of male Salandit that it lives with.
758.name: Salazzle

759.description: Despite its adorable appearance, when it gets angry and flails about, its arms and legs could knock a pro wrestler sprawling.
759.name: Stufful

760.description: This immensely dangerous Pokémon possesses overwhelming physical strength. Its habitat is generally off-limits.
760.name: Bewear

761.description: A delectable aroma pours from its body. They are often swallowed whole by Toucannon lured by that wafting deliciousness.
761.name: Bounsweet

762.description: The sepals on its head developed to protect its body. These are quite hard, so even if pecked by bird Pokémon, this Pokémon is totally fine.
762.name: Steenee

763.description: Its long, striking legs aren't just for show but to be used to kick with skill. In victory, it shows off by kicking the defeated, laughing boisterously.
763.name: Tsareena

764.description: It attaches flowers to its highly nutritious vine. This revitalizes the flowers, and they give off an aromatic scent.
764.name: Comfey

765.description: Known for its extreme intelligence, this Pokémon will look down on inexperienced Trainers, so it's best suited to veteran Trainers.
765.name: Oranguru

766.description: They form groups of roughly 20 individuals. Their mutual bond is remarkable—they will never let down a comrade.
766.name: Passimian

767.description: This Pokémon is a coward. As it desperately dashes off, the flailing of its many legs leaves a sparkling clean path in its wake.
767.name: Wimpod

768.description: With a flashing slash of its giant sharp claws, it cleaves seawater—or even air—right in two.
768.name: Golisopod

769.description: Born from a sand mound playfully built by a child, this Pokémon embodies the grudges of the departed.
769.name: Sandygast

770.description: Possessed people controlled by this Pokémon transformed its sand mound into a castle. As it evolved, its power to curse grew ever stronger.
770.name: Palossand

771.description: It lives in shallow seas, such as areas near a beach. It can eject its internal organs, which it uses to engulf its prey or battle enemies.
771.name: Pyukumuku

772.description: The heavy control mask it wears suppresses its intrinsic capabilities. This Pokémon has some hidden special power.
772.name: Type: Null

773.description: Its trust in its partner is what awakens it. This Pokémon is capable of changing its type, a flexibility that is well displayed in battle.
773.name: Silvally

774.description: Originally making its home in the ozone layer, it hurtles to the ground when the shell enclosing its body grows too heavy.
774.name: Minior

775.description: It is born asleep, and it dies asleep. All its movements are apparently no more than the results of it tossing and turning in its dreams.
775.name: Komala

776.description: The shell on its back is chemically unstable and explodes violently if struck. The hole in its stomach is its weak point.
776.name: Turtonator

777.description: The spiny fur on its back is normally at rest. When this Pokémon becomes agitated, its fur stands on end and stabs into its attackers.
777.name: Togedemaru

778.description: Its actual appearance is unknown. A scholar who saw what was under its rag was overwhelmed by terror and died from the shock.
778.name: Mimikyu

779.description: When it unleashes its psychic power from the protuberance on its head, the grating sound of grinding teeth echoes through the area.
779.name: Bruxish

780.description: It has a compassionate personality, but if it is angered, it completely destroys its surroundings with its intense breath.
780.name: Drampa

781.description: Swinging its massive anchor, it can KO Wailord in a single blow. What appears to be green seaweed is actually its body.
781.name: Dhelmise

782.description: It expresses its feelings by smacking its scales. Metallic sounds echo through the tall mountains where Jangmo-o lives.
782.name: Jangmo-o

783.description: It leaps at its prey with a courageous shout. Its scaly punches tear its opponents to shreds.
783.name: Hakamo-o

784.description: When it spots enemies, it threatens them by jingling the scales on its tail. Weak opponents will crack and flee in panic.
784.name: Kommo-o

785.description: This guardian deity of Melemele is brimming with curiosity. It summons thunderclouds and stores their lightning inside its body.
785.name: Tapu Koko

786.description: This guardian deity of Akala is guilelessly cruel. The fragrant aroma of flowers is the source of its energy.
786.name: Tapu Lele

787.description: It pulls large trees up by the roots and swings them around. It causes vegetation to grow, and then it absorbs energy from the growth.
787.name: Tapu Bulu

788.description: The dense fog it creates brings the downfall and destruction of its confused enemies. Ocean currents are the source of its energy.
788.name: Tapu Fini

789.description: Its body is gaseous and frail. It slowly grows as it collects dust from the atmosphere.
789.name: Cosmog

790.description: Motionless as if dead, its body is faintly warm to the touch. In the distant past, it was called the cocoon of the stars.
790.name: Cosmoem

791.description: It is said to live in another world. The intense light it radiates from the surface of its body can make the darkest of nights light up like midday.
791.name: Solgaleo

792.description: It is said to be a female evolution of Cosmog. When its third eye activates, away it flies to another world.
792.name: Lunala

793.description: One of several mysterious Ultra Beasts. People on the street report observing those infested by it suddenly becoming violent.
793.name: Nihilego

794.description: This Ultra Beast appeared from another world. It shows off its body, but whether that display is a boast or a threat remains unclear.
794.name: Buzzwole

795.description: One of the dangerous Ultra Beasts, it has been spotted running across the land at terrific speeds.
795.name: Pheromosa

796.description: One of the mysterious life-forms known as Ultra Beasts. Astonishing electric shocks emanate from its entire body, according to witnesses.
796.name: Xurkitree

797.description: It appeared from the Ultra Wormhole. Witnesses observed it flying across the sky at high speed.
797.name: Celesteela

798.description: This Ultra Beast came from the Ultra Wormhole. It seems not to attack enemies on its own, but its sharp body is a dangerous weapon in itself.
798.name: Kartana

799.description: It has gobbled mountains and swallowed whole buildings, according to reports. It's one of the Ultra Beasts.
799.name: Guzzlord

800.description: Reminiscent of the Ultra Beasts, this life-form, apparently asleep underground, is thought to have come from another world in ancient times.
800.name: Necrozma

801.description: This artificial Pokémon, constructed more than 500 years ago, can understand human speech but cannot itself speak.
801.name: Magearna

802.description: Able to conceal itself in shadows, it never appears before humans, so its very existence was the stuff of myth.
802.name: Marshadow
